problem_text: B.A. Bovenzi and G.A. Pearse, Jr. (J. Chem. Soc. Dalton Trans., 2793 (1997)) synthesized coordination compounds of the tridentate ligand pyridine-2,6-diamidoxime $\left(7, \mathrm{C}_7 \mathrm{H}_9 \mathrm{~N}_5 \mathrm{O}_2\right)$. The compound which they isolated from the reaction of the ligand with $\mathrm{CuSO}_4(\mathrm{aq})$ did not contain a $\left[\mathrm{Cu}\left(\mathrm{C}_7 \mathrm{H}_9 \mathrm{~N}_5 \mathrm{O}_2\right)_2\right]^{2+}$ complex cation as expected. Instead, X-ray diffraction analysis revealed a linear polymer of formula $\left[\mathrm{Cu}\left(\mathrm{C}_7 \mathrm{H}_9 \mathrm{~N}_5 \mathrm{O}_2\right)\left(\mathrm{SO}_4\right) \cdot 2 \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right]_n$, which features bridging sulfate groups. The unit cell was primitive monoclinic with $a=1.0427 \mathrm{~nm}, b=0.8876 \mathrm{~nm}, c=1.3777 \mathrm{~nm}$, and $\beta=93.254^{\circ}$. The mass density of the crystals is $2.024 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~cm}^{-3}$. How many monomer units are there in the unit cell?
